io.zbox.zboxfs

Class RepoOpener

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.zbox.zboxfs.RepoOpener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class RepoOpener
extends Object
    A builder used to create a repository in various manners.

    This builder exposes the ability to configure how a Repo is opened and what operations are permitted on the opened repository.

    Generally speaking, when using RepoOpener, you'll first call RepoOpener(), then chain calls to methods to set each option, then call open(String, String), passing the URI of the repository and password you're trying to open. This will give you an opened Repo instance that you can further operate on.

    Examples

    Opening a repository and creating it if it doesn't exist.

     Repo repo = new RepoOpener().create(true).open("mem://foo", "pwd");

    Specify options for creating a repository.

     Repo repo = new RepoOpener()
     .opsLimit(OpsLimit.MODERATE)
     .memLimit(MemLimit.INTERACTIVE)
     .create(true)
     .open("mem://foo", "pwd");
    See Also:
    Repo

    • Method Detail

      • opsLimit

        public RepoOpener opsLimit(OpsLimit limit)
        Sets the password hash operation limit.

        This option is only used for creating a repository. OpsLimit.INTERACTIVE is the default.

        Parameters:
        limit - password hash operation limit
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • memLimit

        public RepoOpener memLimit(MemLimit limit)
        Sets the password hash memory limit.

        This option is only used for creating a repository. MemLimit.INTERACTIVE is the default.

        Parameters:
        limit - password hash memory limit
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • cipher

        public RepoOpener cipher(Cipher cipher)
        Sets the crypto cipher encrypts the repository.

        This option is only used for creating a repository. Cipher.AES is the default if CPU supports AES-NI instructions, otherwise it will fall back to Cipher.XCHACHA.

        Parameters:
        cipher - crypto cipher
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • create

        public RepoOpener create(boolean create)
        Sets the option for creating a new repository.

        This option indicates whether a new repository will be created if the repository does not yet already exist.

        Parameters:
        create - create repo flag
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • createNew

        public RepoOpener createNew(boolean createNew)
        Sets the option for creating a new repository.

        This option indicates whether a new repository will be created. No repository is allowed to exist at the target path.

        Parameters:
        createNew - create new repo flag
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • compress

        public RepoOpener compress(boolean compress)
        Sets the option for data compression.

        This options indicates whether the LZ4 compression should be used in the repository. Default is false.

        Parameters:
        compress - compress flag
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • versionLimit

        public RepoOpener versionLimit(int limit)
        Sets the repo-wise maximum number of file content versions.

        The version limit must be within [1, 255], default is 1. This setting is a repository-wise setting, individual file can overwrite it by using OpenOptions.versionLimit(int).

        Parameters:
        limit - maximum number of file content versions
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • dedupChunk

        public RepoOpener dedupChunk(boolean dedup)
        Sets the repo-wise file data chunk deduplication flag.

        This option indicates whether data chunk should be deduped when writing data to a file. This setting is a repository-wise setting, individual file can overwrite it by using OpenOptions.dedupChunk(boolean). Default is false.

        Parameters:
        dedup - dedup flag
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • readOnly

        public RepoOpener readOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Sets the option for read-only mode.
        Parameters:
        readOnly - read only flag
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • force

        public RepoOpener force(boolean force)
        Sets the option to open repo regardless repo lock.

        Normally, repo will be exclusively locked once it is opened. But when this option is set to true, the repo will be opened regardless the repo lock. This option breaks exclusive access to repo, so use it cautiously. Default is false.

        Parameters:
        force - force open flag
        Returns:
        this repo opener

      • open

        public Repo open(String uri,
                 String pwd)
          throws ZboxException
        Opens a repository at URI with the password and options specified by this repo opener.

        In general, the URI is structured as follows:

         storage://username:password@/path/data?key=value&key2=value2
 |------| |-----------------||---------||-------------------|
    |              |              |               |
 identifier    authority         path         parameters

        Only identifier and path are required, all the others are optional.

        Supported storage:

        • Memory storage, URI identifier is mem://

          After the identifier is a name to distinguish a particular memory storage location.

          For example, mem://foobar.

        • OS file system storage, URI identifier is file://

          After the identifier is the path to a directory on OS file system. It can be a relative or absolute path.

          For example, file://./foo/bar.

        • Zbox Cloud Storage, URI identifier is zbox://

          Visit zbox.io to learn more about Zbox Cloud Storage.

        Parameters:
        uri - the repo's location URI
        pwd - the password to encrypt repo
        Returns:
        the opened repo instance
        Throws:
        ZboxException - if any error happened

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this instance and releases any resources associated with this instance.
